article.title: This Year in Photos
article.description: The Daily Nexus looks back at this year’s highlights, from Nobel Prize winner Shuji Nakamura to the May 23 memorial events that were illuminated by blue LEDs that Nakamura invented. *Correction...
article.content:
The Daily Nexus looks back at this year’s highlights, from Nobel Prize winner Shuji Nakamura to the May 23 memorial events that were illuminated by blue LEDs that Nakamura invented.

Materials and electrical and computer engineering professor Shuji Nakamura was awarded the 2014 Nobel Prize in Physics on Oct. 7 along with Isamu Akasaki and Hiroshi Amano for the invention of the first blue light-emitting diode (LED). McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Approximately 5,000 students gathered at Storke Plaza on Oct. 8, 2014 for a “Come Together: Remember, Reconnect, & Unite” concert to promote a safer community in commemoration of the six students who lost their lives during the events of May 23 last year. UCSB Alumnus Jack Johnson performed at the event along with several student groups and artists.Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

The Associated Students Program Board hosted alternative rock band Young the Giant in the Thunderdome during a rained-out Halloween night on Oct. 31, 2014. The band performed in adult diapers and bibs, donning costumes to immerse the audience in the spirit of the iconic Isla Vista party weekend. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Students held a rally on Nov. 20, 2014 against proposed tuition hikes by the University of California Board of Regents, which called for an annual 5 percent increase in tuition over the next five years due to a lack of state funding for the UC. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Assemblymember Das Williams introduced Assembly Bill 3 (AB 3) to the California State Assembly on Dec. 1, 2014 to create a Community Services District (CSD) in Isla Vista to provide infrastructure and increased resources to the residents of the community. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

The Isla Vista Tenants Union (IVTU) announced the beginning of a campaign on Jan. 20, 2015 to provide financial assistance to five households allegedly evicted from Abrego Villas on 6754 and 6764 Abrego Road in I.V. in Oct. 2014. Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

Beta Theta Pi and Phi Sigma Kappa fraternities lost their charters during the 2014-2015 school year in December and February, respectively, due to various charges concerning alleged violations of university policy. Paris Cullen/Daily Nexus

Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP) installed a mural wall in the Arbor on April 6, 2015 leading up to an A.S. Senate decision on whether to pass a resolution calling for the university to divest from businesses profiting from alleged human rights violations in Palestine. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Two UCSB students were hospitalized after a domestic disturbance which resulted in shots being fired at Sabado Tarde Road on May 11, 2015. Two suspects, 19-year-old Jose Guadalupe Gutierrez of Goleta and 22-year-old James Joshua Taylor of Lompoc, were arrested and booked for charges including attempted murder, robbery and participation in a criminal street gang. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

The annual end-of-the-year Extravaganza concert put on by the A.S. Program Board brought performers Bad Rabbits, AlunaGeorge, Joey Bada$$, Madeon and headliner Miguel to Harder Stadium on May 17, 2015 for a six-hour-long music festival dedicated to a mixture of popular and upcoming artists. Alex Messick/Daily Nexus

Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

A group of students headed by survivors of sexual assault Alejandra Melgoza, Lexi Weyrick and Melissa Vasquez staged a 13-hour sit-in of Chancellor Henry T. Yang’s office from May 13, 2015 to May 14, 2015 to demand specific policies to improve the handling of sexual assault cases, concluding the night with a signature from Yang ensuring the enactment of 13 sanctions in favor of survivors. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

University administration, Associated Students and several student groups held May 23 memorial events illuminated by Shuji Nakamura’s blue LED lights to unify the community and commemorate the six lives lost in the events of May 23 last year. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

*Correction: A previous version of this article stated professor Shuji Nakamura was a colleague of Isamu Akasaki and Hiroshi Amano. They are co-recipients of the Nobel Prize, but have never worked together; thus, they are not colleagues.

related.title: Photos from the UC-wide Union Strike
related.description: On November 20, members of the AFSCME 3299 and UC Student Workers Union UAW 2865 from nine UC campuses went on strike to protest grievances by the UC administration.
related.content:
On November 20, members of the AFSCME 3299 and UC Student Workers Union UAW 2865 from nine UC campuses went on strike to protest grievances by the UC administration.  Several Nexus photographers were on hand to capture various images of the protests that day.

The related Nexus article can be read here:

Photo Credits: Eric Swenson, Peter Vandenbelt, Cameryn Brock

Striking AFSCME 3299 union members and its supporters march down Storke Plaza during the UC-wide protests by members of AFSCME 3299 and UAW 2865 on November 20, 2013. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

Union members and supporters strike in front of Elings Hall near the Henley Gate in early morning. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

A driver for a linen and uniform service company pauses on the road–creating a ten-car traffic in the process–to show his solidarity and shake the hand of one of the leaders of the strike. The photographer noted that the driver proceeded to park his truck, and come out of his work uniform to join the strike. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A speaker rallies striking union members its supporters during the UC-wide protests on November 20, 2013. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A union worker of the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees 3299 urges passing motorists to honk their horns in support for the striking workers in front of Elings Hall near the Henley Gate in the east side of the UCSB Campus. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

Two bicyclists–one of them visibly engaged by the ongoing strike–ride by protesters on the bike path by Storke Tower. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

Student workers of the Associated Students ticket office observe protesters–seen in the reflections of the windows–marching by Corwin Pavilion during the UC-wide AFSCME 3299 union strike on November 20, 2013. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A member of the UC Student Workers Union UAW 2865 protests alongside AFSCME 3299 protesters in front of Storke Tower during the midday. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A union member of the AFSCME 3299 rallies the crowd with a loudspeaker in front of Elings Hall during the November 20 UC-wide protests against the UC Administration. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

Striking union members and supporters for the AFSCME 3299 union gather in front of Storke Tower. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

A striking AFSCME 3299 union member gives an interview for the television crew of KEYT of Santa Barbara in front of Elings Hall during the November 20 UC-wide protests. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

A UCSB student bicycles by striking union members in front of Storke Tower. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

related.title: In Photos: The Aftermath of the Isla Vista Shooting Spree
related.description: A collection of photos of the crime scenes by Daily Nexus photographers.
related.content:
A Santa Barbara County Sheriff examines a bullet hole that was previously unseen by the investigation team on the 6500 block of Del Playa Drive on Saturday morning. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

A police officer guards a crime scene near the 7-11 convenience store at the Loop Apartments while tenants observe from their second-story residence. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

A second body is removed from the residence where shooting suspect Elliot Rodger lived. Rodger is believed to have fatally stabbed all three of his roommates in their residence on 6598 Seville Road before he began his shooting spree through Isla Vista. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Richard Martinez — father of UCSB student Christopher Ross Michael-Martinez, who was killed in Isla Vista Friday night — breaks down while speaking to reporters Saturday afternoon at the Sheriff’s Department headquarters in Santa Barbara. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

The cousin of Martinez, who was fatally wounded inside IV Deli Mart, and an unidentified family member, left, stand beside a grieving Richard Martinez as he spoke to reporters Saturday afternoon. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Reporters gathered at the press conference at the Santa Barbara County Sheriff’s Department headquarters late Saturday afternoon. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Sheriff Bill Brown opens a booklet as he answers questions during the press conference regarding Saturday afternoon’s massacre. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Sheriff Bill Brown provides details about the Isla Vista shooting spree to reporters during the press conference at the Santa Barbara County Sheriff Department’s headquarters on Saturday afternoon. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Dr. Stephen Kaminski — the Trauma Director for the Cottage Hospital system — gives details about the injured victims who are still recovering during Saturday’s press conference. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

The press conference included prominent figures such as UCSB Chancellor Henry T. Yang and Santa Barbara county Third District Supervisor Doreen Farr. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

A map displaying the multitude of crime scenes from the murder spree is displayed during the press conference on Saturday afternoon. Rodger’s course involved 12 locations total. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Reporters and cameramen converge on a sign that divulges information including the shooter’s full name, date of birth, and firearms found in the suspect’s car. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

related.title: Photos from the Convocation Ceremony
related.description: Incoming students of UCSB received a warm welcome from their Chancellor, Henry T. Yang, and UC Regent and UCSB alum George Kieffer on Monday. Photo Credits: Kenneth Song
related.content:
Incoming students of UCSB received a warm welcome from their Chancellor, Henry T. Yang, and UC Regent and UCSB alum George Kieffer on Monday.

Photo Credits: Kenneth Song

UCSB faculty waltz into Convocation on the Faculty Lawn by the lagoon.

The a cappella group Naked Voices sing the National Anthem before Convocation.

Chancellor Henry T. Yang welcomes the incoming freshmen of the Class of 2018.

George Marshall (in the yellow robe) and Ali Guthy (center right) will new occupations within UCSB: Marshall will serve as the new executive vice chancellor, while Guthy begins her stint as President of Associated Students.

Storke Tower looms in the background while students listen to the Convocation speeches.

Two attendees sneak in a conversation.

An airplane drags a Greek life advertisement above the attendees.

Regent and UCSB alum George Kieffer was the highlight of Convocation.

Outgoing executive vice chancellor Michael Young, center, sits idly during George Kieffer’s speech.
